description.narrative:
The overall objective of this programme is to promote good governance, democracy and human rights in Tanzania. The programme encompasses three complementary components: a) Strengthening the demand for good governance through civil society and the media, b) Enhancing the rule of law and justice, and c) Reinforcing public financial management (PFM). Cross-cutting issues include gender, human rights, democratic participation, and corruption control.
Support to the first programme component is channelled through The Foundation for Civil Society (FCS), which provides grants and other capacity building services to various civil society organizations, and the Tanzania Media Fund (TMF), a grant-making institution which provides fellowship programmes to increase the quality of investigative journalism.
The second component is aimed at public reforms of the legal sector, and the provision of paralegal aid to marginalized groups. Consequently, the programme operates through two subcomponents: 1) The Legal Sector Reform Programme (LSRP), a basket fund which provides funding for a reformation of Tanzania's juridical sector; and 2) The Legal Services Facility (LSF), a basket fund which organizes grants for legal aid providers in order to expand the geographical coverage and quality of legal aid.
The third programme component will strengthen PFM structures including budgeting, expenditure management, transparency, debt management, fiscal forecasting, and auditing processes. Support is provided to the fourth phase of the Public Financial Management Reform Programme (PFMRP-IV). Danida provides funding through a basket fund modality with several other donors for PFM reforms of key oversight bodies, including the National Audit Office and the Public Procurement Regulatory Authority. The support will strengthen the foundation of other public sector support programmes, especially the general budget support programme.
